channel.title: business on Newsround
channel.description: Recent content in business on Newsround

item.title: California orders Musk's xAI to stop allowing fake sexualized images of minors - Axios
item.description: AI-generated sexual imagery of children has raised alarms with regulators and lawmakers.

item.title: Trump Blasts Dimon, Threatens to Sue JPMorgan Over Debanking - Bloomberg.com
item.description: President Donald Trump railed against JPMorgan Chase & Co. and its leader Jamie Dimon, threatening to sue the banking giant over his claim that he was debanked after the Jan. 6, 2021, Capitol riot.

item.title: Trump threatens to sue JPMorgan Chase for 'debanking' him - CNBC
item.description: President Trump threatened to sue JPMorgan for allegedly “debanking” him following the Jan. 6 insurrection in 2021.

item.title: Cases of 'AI Psychosis' Are Being Reported. How Dangerous Is It? - ScienceAlert
item.description: Artificial intelligence is increasingly woven into everyday life, from chatbots that offer companionship to algorithms that shape what we see online.

item.title: These prophets of economic doom are worried about another collapse - The Washington Post
item.description: The current investment boom is triggering déjà vu for some economists and traders who successfully predicted past economic crashes.

item.title: As Trump's deadline for a cap on credit card rates looms, banks have only questions and no answers - ABC News
item.description: Trump has demanded a 10% cap on credit card interest rates by Jan. 20.

item.title: Trump’s crusade against Big Tech’s energy spending highlights a problem with no easy answers - MarketWatch
item.description: ‘It’s not something that can be solved overnight’: AI has overwhelmed the electricity grid, and everyone from average Americans to Trump is outraged

item.title: Ahead of Q4 Earnings, Let’s Look at Who Owns Netflix Stock (NFLX) - TipRanks
item.description: Streaming giant Netflix (NFLX) is set to report its fourth-quarter Fiscal 2025 results after market close on Tuesday, January 20. The stock has gained about 2.5% in 2025. Wall Street expects Netflix

item.title: Over 38,000 gallons of distilled water recalled in 6 states including Illinois, Indiana - CBS News
item.description: Over 38,000 gallons of distilled water were recalled in six states, including Illinois.

item.title: Popular vodka brand files Chapter 7 bankruptcy to liquidate - thestreet.com
item.description: The global vodka brand filed a motion to convert its Chapter 11 bankruptcy reorganization to a Chapter 7 liquidation.

item.title: Best photos from 2026 Detroit Auto Show Charity Preview - Detroit Free Press
item.description: The best images from the 2026 Detroit Auto Show Charity Preview held at Huntington Place in Detroit on Friday, Jan. 16, 2026.

item.title: 'Big Short' investor Michael Burry says the AI boom will end badly. He shared an old Warren Buffett story to explain why. - Business Insider
item.description: Michael Burry of “The Big Short” fame relayed a Warren Buffett story to warn of wasteful tech spending, and took aim at Nvidia and Palantir again.

item.title: They quit their day jobs to bet on current events. A look inside the prediction market mania - NPR
item.description: Prediction market apps are thriving in Trump’s second term, with traders betting on migrant deportations to election outcomes. A community of young, mostly male and very online traders are driving the industry’s bonanza.

item.title: ‘He’s an idiot’: Musk and Ryanair’s O’Leary trade insults in Starlink Wi-Fi row - politico.eu
item.description: What began as a disagreement over airline internet has turned into a full-blown war of words.

item.title: Supreme Court will review Monsanto’s bid for immunity in Roundup lawsuits - The Washington Post
item.description: The Supreme Court will consider an appeal by the manufacturer of Roundup weed killer over suits that allege it failed to warn consumers about health dangers.

item.title: Suzanna’s Kitchen Recalls Ready-To-Eat Grilled Chicken Breast Fillet Products due to Possible Listeria Contamination - fsis.usda.gov
item.description: None

item.title: ChatGPT ads are coming, and they’re not exactly subtle [Gallery] - 9to5Google
item.description: OpenAI today announced the inevitable, that ChatGPT will start showing ads in your queries, and they’re pretty prominent too. Ads…

item.title: Northeast governors and White House team up to pressure electric grid on data centers and prices - Pittsburgh Post-Gazette
item.description: False

item.title: Nvidia suppliers halt H200 output after China blocks chip shipments - Financial Times
item.description: Parts makers concerned about whether Beijing will allow imports of AI processors

item.title: Exclusive: Elon Musk’s Boring Co. is studying a tunnel project to Tesla Gigafactory near Reno - Fortune
item.description: The surge of traffic, and accidents, on the highway that leads to the burgeoning industrial center in northern Nevada is driving a search for alternatives.

item.title: Bond yields jump after Trump hints Hassett won't be named Fed chair as Wall Street eyes hawk Warsh - Fortune
item.description: “I actually want to keep you where you are, if you want to know the truth,” Trump said at a White House event.

item.description: The Official website of The United States Committee on Banking, Housing, and Urban Affairs

item.title: Trip.com shares plunge more than 20% as China opens antitrust probe into company - CNBC
item.description: In a statement, Trip.com said it would “actively cooperate” with the investigation, and added its business operations remain normal.

item.title: NCAA asks CFTC to suspend prediction markets - ESPN
item.description: The NCAA asked a federal regulatory body to stop prediction markets from offering trades on college sports until more safeguards are in place.

item.title: Toyota Industries shares hit record high after Toyota Motor raises buyout offer to over $35 billion - CNBC
item.description: Toyota Motor sweetened the tender offer price for buying out the carmaker by more than 15% to over $35 billion.

item.title: Chicago business news: Harold's Chicken Shack CEO Kristen Pierce-Sherrod, founder's daughter, dies at 55, family says - ABC7 Chicago
item.description: Harold’s Chicken CEO Kristen Pierce-Sherrod, the daughter of the iconic Chicago restaurant chain’s founder, has died at age 55.

item.title: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures slide after Wall Street's first back-to-back losses in 2026 - Yahoo Finance
item.description: Stock futures fell following consecutive days of losses. Investors have been buffeted by industry losses and geopolitical issues.

item.title: A part that broke on a UPS plane that crashed in Kentucky failed 4 times on other planes years ago - AP News
item.description: The National Transportation Safety Board says Boeing warned plane owners in 2011 about a flaw in the part that failed and contributed to the engine flying off a UPS plane before it crashed and killed 15 in November but at that point the plane manufacturer did…

item.title: AI Can’t Touch These Skilled Trade Jobs. If Only Enough Humans Would Fill Them. - The Wall Street Journal
item.description: At Crane Stationery, the craft of high-precision engraving is in danger of becoming lost art

item.title: Readout from Secretary of the Treasury Scott Bessent’s Meeting with Finance Minister Satsuki Katayama of Japan - U.S. Department of the Treasury (.gov)
item.description: WASHINGTON – On Monday, January 12, Secretary of the Treasury Scott Bessent met with Finance Minister Satsuki Katayama of Japan. The Secretary thanked the Minister for attending the United States’ critical minerals summit and emphasized the importance of crit…

item.title: Oil prices fall after Trump signals he could hold off on attacking Iran - CNBC
item.description: Trump told reporters in the Oval Office that “we’ve been told that the killing in Iran is stopping. It’s stopped. It’s stopping, and there’s no plan for executions.”

item.title: Committing $9B Annual Payout; Strengthening Stewardship of Funds - Gates Foundation
item.description: Foundation is planning operating expenditures at approximately 14% annually to ensure more funds are directed to the programs and people we serve

item.title: Banks Say U.S. Consumers Remain Resilient Despite Economic Pressures - The Wall Street Journal
item.description: Executives warn Trump’s effort to address affordability with 10% cap on credit-card interest rates would hurt economy

item.title: Trump's new push for lower rates - Axios
item.description: The Fed isn’t moving fast enough on interest rates for the president.

item.title: Healthy Returns: Novo Nordisk CEO on GLP-1 pricing, and more insights from the JPM conference - CNBC
item.description: Novo Nordisk’s CEO spoke about GLP-1 pricing and Pfizer’s CEO spoke about the company’s obesity ambitions while at the JPMorgan Healthcare Conference.
